Accommodations
Edison Festival of Lights. All Rights Reserved.

February 2025
Feb
1 –
Antique Car Show
9AM & 2PM
Location: Edison & Ford Winter Estates
Antique cars will be exhibited on the Ford lawn along the Caloosahatchee, plus there will be food trucks and music. Included with admission.
Feb 1 –
Thomas Alva Edison Kiwanis Science & Engineering Fair
9AM – 4:30PM
Location: Alico Arena
Our Regional Science & Engineering Fair (RSEF) program challenges thousands of students from across Southwest Florida to go beyond their classroom studies and pursue independent project-based research.
Feb
4 –
Mrs. Edison’s Hymn Sing
1PM & 4PM
Location: First Presbyterian Church – Downtown Fort Myers
Celebrate the Edison Festival of Light at the annual Mrs. Edison’s Hymn Sing. Sponsored by the Galloway Family of Dealerships & Susan Bennett Marketing and Media. Presented by First Presbyterian Church. Canned goods and cash donations appreciated for The Soup Kitchen at Community Cooperative.
Feb 11 –
Thomas Edison’s Birthday Celebration
10AM
Location: Edison & Ford Winter Estates
Celebrate the birthday of Thomas Edison with cake and a musical performance. Free event (does not include tours, museum or lab).
Feb
8 –
STEMtastic Day of Discovery
10AM – 2PM
Location: Caloosa Sound Convention Center
STEMtastic Day of Discovery is an award-winning STEM event that provides an exciting atmosphere for children and families to experience Science, Technology, Engineering, Math and the Arts.
Feb
8 –
Mutt Strutt
11AM – 3PM
Location: Centennial Park & Edwards and Monroe
Dog lovers, families, vendors and pet agencies gather for fun, food and mutt strutt! Pooches and owners in costumes or their finest bling–even a few doggie floats mixed in! We will have wiener dog races and the Pet Parade.
Click to download the Mutt Strutt flyer.
Click here to download the Vendor Application.
Feb 8 & 9 –
Edison Garden Festival
9AM – 4PM
Location: Edison & Ford Winter Estates
Close to 100 garden vendors will have exotic and native plants available for sale, plus there will be food trucks and music. Free event (does not include tours, museum or lab).
Feb 9 –
Junior Fun Run
12PM – 1PM
Location: First Street in Downtown River District
Hundreds of young participants turn out to show their determination and pride. The Junior Fun Run is open to children in grades five and below.
Click here to sign up!
Feb
9 –
Junior Parade
1:30PM – 3:30PM
Location: Downtown River District
Florida’s largest youth parade showcases the talents of hundreds of Southwest Florida children and their families. Over 100 units including floats, marching bands, street performers, clowns and dignitaries parade their way around.
Click here for the application.
Feb
9 –
Junior Coronation & Awards
After Junior Parade
Location: Sidney & Berne Davis Art Center
Immediately following the Junior Parade, participants and family members gather at the Sidney and Berne Davis Art Center for awards and the highly anticipated crowning of the Junior King and Queen.
Feb
15 –
5K Run
5:15PM START
Location: Downtown River District/Edwards Drive/US 41
Well over 1,400 participants and thousands of spectators take over the streets of the Downtown River District.
Click here for info & to sign up!
Feb
15 –
Edison Festival of Light Parade Party
4:00PM –  11:00PM
Location: 1811 Royal Palm Ave, Fort Myers, FL
Join us for our annual Edison Festival of Light celebration event which features FREE Bounce Houses, 4 Food Trucks (Dynamite Street Eatz, Yo Samara’s, Easy Cheesy, and Get Fried) and tons of delicious beer, wine, cider, seltzers, cocktails and more! Pet and family friendly, come pre-game for the parade right here at Millennial!
Feb
15 –
Grand Parade of Light
7PM – 10PM
Location: Downtown River District/Edwards Drive
Named as the largest night parade in the Southeast, the Grand Parade is a two-hour extravaganza featuring national participants & local marching bands, floats, local government and law enforcement officials, clowns and much more.
Click here for the application.
Feb
15 –
Grand Parade of Light VIP Tent
5:30PM – Until End of Parade
Location: Downtown River District/Edwards and Hendry
Step into the VIP tent for an exclusive experience at the 86th annual Edison Festival of Light parade. Indulge in a delectable array of fabulous food and drinks, meticulously crafted to tantalize your taste buds. As you savor each bite, a talented DJ keeps the atmosphere alive with toe-tapping beats and infectious tunes. With VIP parade seating, you’ll have the best view on the parade route, allowing you to immerse yourself in the spectacular sights and sounds of this grand celebration. Join us in this unforgettable VIP tent experience and elevate your parade experience to a whole new level of extravagance.
Click Here to get VIP Tickets!
Feb
15 – 16 –
Crafts on the River
10:00AM – 5:00PM
Location: Along Edwards Drive
Join us for the Crafts On The River, a 2 day event presented by: The 87th Annual Edison Festival of Light & Local Ladies Social Network, Inc. / LLSN Events. Mark your calendars for Saturday & Sunday February 15th & 16th 2025 10AM-5PM for this amazing festival featuring local art, crafts & so much more! You don’t want to miss it!
Where: Caloosa Sound Amphitheater.
Feb
16 –
Classic Car Show
10:00AM – 3:00PM
Location: Along Edwards Drive
Hundreds of classic vehicles line Edwards Drive for a day of nostalgia and pride. Cruise in with your classic, browse others and meet the owners. At the same time, enjoy food, beverages, and Crafts on the River.
For more information on this event or to register please reach out to John with Hot Chili Rods via email
hotchilirods@aol.com

Home
About
Events
Get Involved
Contact
Accommodations
Edison Festival of Lights. All Rights Reserved.

In 1885, Thomas Alva Edison built his winter home in Fort Myers, Florida on the Caloosahatchee River. Throughout the 50 years Edison wintered in Fort Myers, he dedicated time in support of local charities and projects. He died in 1931, having successfully received over 1,000 patents for his inventions.
The idea of a celebration to commemorate Edison’s life of achievement evolved into the Edison Pageant of Light in 1938, with a Coronation Ball, a parade, a band concert and a memorial service. The successful three-day event grew, and later increased to a week-long festival, and finally to two full weeks. In 1988, demand for more public events was great, but the Pageant membership struggled to provide enough volunteers to grow the event. The choices were to limit the growth of the public events, or create a new public corporation to assume the responsibility for all events and open them to the public.
In a unanimous vote, the Pageant board elected to turn over all the public events to a new non-profit corporation. This paved the road to the possibilities of civic celebrations in which the entire community could participate. In 1989, the new organization, the Edison Festival of Light, Inc. officially assumed responsibility for all public events celebrating Thomas Edison and the City of Fort Myers.
